citeinfo.title: U.S. Geographic Names Information System Schools : ESRI Data & Maps 2009

serinfo.issue: 2009 Data Update - World, Europe, United States, and Mexico

descript.abstract: U.S. Geographic Names Information System Schools represents an automated inventory of the proper names and locations of physical and cultural geographic features located throughout the United States and its Territories.
descript.purpose: Geographic Names Information System (GNIS), of which U.S. Geographic Names Information System Schools is a part, promotes geographic feature name standardization and serves as the Federal Government's repository of information regarding feature name spellings and applications for features in United States and its Territories. The names listed in the inventory can be published on Federal maps, charts, and in other documents. The feature locative information has been used in emergency preparedness, marketing, site-selection and analysis, genealogical and historical research, and transportation routing applications.
descript.supplinf: Largest scale when displaying the data: 1:24,000.

place.placekey: Virgin Islands of the United States

Outside the United States-Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local ESRI Office. This information can be found at http://www.esri.com/company/locations.html. For other questions or comments, you may contact ESRI headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.0.1770

dataqual.logic: The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format using either ESRI SDC Data Development Kit Professional 2 (DDKP2) or tools in ArcGIS. The SDC data set is then loaded into ArcSDE to verify and validate the geometry.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.

horizpa.horizpar: The geospatial part of this data set was calculated from latitude/longitude coordinates accurate to within 1 arc second of latitude or longitude.The source data is based upon the use of printed or electronic source graphics which are compiled to meet National Map Accuracy Standards.

citeinfo.title: U.S. Geographic Names Information System (GNIS)
citeinfo.othercit: The web page is titled 'U.S. Board on Geographic Names: Domestic Names - State and Topical Gazetteer Download Files'. The data set was last revised on January 28, 2008.

citeinfo.title: Tele Atlas StreetMap Premium for ArcGIS - North America

serinfo.sername: Tele Atlas StreetMap Premium for ArcGIS - North America

citeinfo.othercit: Provides information about U.S. Large Area Landmarks to code the LABEL_FLAG attribute.

srcinfo.srccitea: Tele Atlas StreetMap Premium - NA v. 10.0

procstep.procdesc: GNIS was developed by the U.S. Geological Survey in cooperation with the U.S. Board on Geographic Names (BGN) to promote the standardization of feature names. GNIS is being compiled in phases. GNIS Phase I data compilation and edit - Feature name and attribute data were collected from the largest-scale USGS topographic maps available. These data were compared to the records of the U.S. Board on Geographic Names. This phase is complete.GNIS Phase II data compilation and edit - Feature name and attribute data are collected from official state and local sources and other approved sources including historical maps and documents. This phase is not complete.GNIS Maintenance program - Federal and state maintenance cooperators submit new and corrected data in conjunction with their mapping and geographical information system data maintenance programs. The GNIS has an active data gathering and maintenance program. A web-based data date entry and edit application allows authorized users to submit transaction data directly for validation and entry into the database, where it immediately becomes available to all web services and applications. A test and demonstration site is available. Government agencies at all levels are encouraged to join this program. Other organizations and individuals will be considered on a case basis.Partnerships - the Geographic Names Project enters into partnerships with State names authorities and State and local GIS agencies to integrate name, location, and attribute data in the GNIS with State and local datasets. These partnerships utilize GIS and web technology to automate and simplify data maintenance, ensure data consistency, integrity, and accuracy, and meet the requirements of the Board on Geographic Names for national names standardization. Government agencies at all levels are encouraged to join this program. Other organizations and individuals will be considered on a case basis.

The following steps were performed by ESRI: Downloaded the tabular files from the U.S. Geological Survey web site. Converted the files (containing latitude and longitude coordinates) to shapefiles in ArcMap and appended them into one data set. Re-projected Alaska and Hawaii to improve their alignment. Reselected out the nine GNIS data sets based on their class type. Removed features with incorrect coordinates. Adjusted the widths of the NAME attributes. Added the LABEL_FLAG attributes and calculated their values based on whether the features have a corresponding area in U.S. Large Area Landmarks. Converted the data sets to SDC. Created their ArcGIS layer files (.lyr), projection files (.prj), and spatial indices.
procstep.srcused: Tele Atlas StreetMap Premium - NA v. 10.0

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by ESRI: Removed all features where NAME contains 'Squaw'. Converted the data set to SDC. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices.

This layer was originally downloaded from the ESRI Data and Maps and Streetmap North America 9.3.1 (2009 Data Update) DVD. The file was stored in an SDC (Smart Data Compression) format on the DVD. ArcCatalog 9.3 was utilized to export the SDC file into an ArcSDE 9.3.1 database using the "Feature Class to Feature Class" export tool.

enttyp.enttypd: The points represent physical and cultural geographic features located throughout the United States and its Territories.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The name of the geographic feature.
attr.attrdefs: United States Geological Survey, United States Board on Geographic Names

codesetd.codesetn: Principles, Policies, and Procedures: Domestic Geographic Names
codesetd.codesets: Principles, Policies, and Procedures: Domestic Geographic Names, By Donald J. Orth, Executive Secretary, Domestic Geographic Names (emeritus) and Roger L. Payne, Executive Secretary, United States Board on Geographic Names and Domestic Geographic Names, Third printing (revised) and Preliminary Online Edition, 1997

attr.attrdef: The combined state/territory and county FIPS code (five-digit number). The combined code uniquely identifies the county in which the geographic feature is located.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The elevation of the feature in meters relative to sea level.
The indicator that the geographic feature has a corresponding area in U.S. Large Area Landmarks.

edom.edomvd: The geographic feature does not have a corresponding area in U.S. Large Area Landmarks.
The geographic feature has a corresponding area in U.S. Large Area Landmarks.
